intro: Epilobium serratum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often serrated along the edges. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Epilobium serratum is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms.
